main event: On September 10, 1951, a T-33 jet fighter piloted by Maj. Ballard and Lt. Rogers reported seeing a round unidentified object moving at high speed over Sandy Hook, New Jersey.
interesting points: The pilots estimated the object's speed to be above 600 mph, indicating it was unlike any known aircraft., The object was described as circular and metallic in appearance, approximately 30 to 50 feet in diameter., The sighting lasted about 2 minutes and the object disappeared over the sea., None of the tracking radar systems picked up the object, creating uncertainty about its nature., The sighting coincided with the release of balloons by the Evans Signal Laboratory, raising questions about the true identity of the object.
witness description: pilots of the T-33 jet fighter, Maj. Albert S. Ballard and Lt. Wilbert E. Rogers
